title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling a class in a subpackage using ajc without the -d option, a new subpackage directory is created under the existing subpackage directory.
EB: The compiled class should be placed in the specified subpackage directory without creating a new subpackage directory under it.
SR: Compile a class in a subpackage using the ajc -d option.
